alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Marshall (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 24 at 6:42PM CST until February 26 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River Near Shelbyville affecting Bedford and Marshall Counties. For the Duck River...including Shelbyville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Duck River Near Shelbyville. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Areas along the river from Normandy Dam to near Henry Horton State Park begin to be flooded, including agricultural land and access points. In Shelbyville, water begins to approach properties adjacent to the river on S Cannon Blvd between the Hwy 64-Lewis Ave junction and the bridge, and Fisherman`s Park and River Bottom Park are both flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM CST Thursday the stage was 23.2 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river has crested and is expected to continue falling. - Action stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 1245 PM CST.
